main event: A large, round, silver sphere was observed stationary for two hours before decreasing in size and disappearing in Atlanta, Georgia.
interesting points: The event was observed on February 9, 1955, for a duration of 2 hours., The object was identified as a balloon after investigation., The radar detected a fast-moving unidentified target on February 5, 1955, at 4,000 mph., Ground observers could not visually confirm the radar target., The object was tracked on radar for approximately 2 minutes before disappearing.
witness description: Ground observers at the radar station were unable to visually confirm the target.
